oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tennessee National Guardsman hugs girl carrying flower, 1991 March 15
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of an unidentified Tennessee National Guardsman hugging a girl carrying a flower. The soldier is one of 63 members of the 130th Rear Area Operations Center, which returned to the Grubbs-Kyle Training Center at the Smyrna Armory on March 15, 1991. The unit was the first state Army Guard unit to be deployed to the Middle East on August 30, 1990, serving in Saudi Arabia during the Persian Gulf War. Forms part of the Nashville Banner Archives. 1 photograph transparency : col ; 35mm.
